APP DESIGN

In our opinion, apps are almost universally poorly designed, and we find the impact to be unacceptable. A user experience of mediocre quality, as well as diminished revenues resulting from alienating technology-intimidated market segments — these implications simply don't excite us.

We love exploring. We love to learn about how humans work, and to get right into the head of our users, so we can craft the best interfaces.

We're not interested in doing it cheaper or faster than the other guy. We craft only the best interfaces, and that level of thinking doesn't come cheap.

Further constraining ourselves, we only work on projects whose value we appreciate as being a contribution to society. And we only work with people we like, trust, and admire.

Raphael's Laws

  1. Aliveness

  2. Conceptual clarity

  3. Deference to content
